18namespace v8 {
19namespace internal {
20
21// We sample with a Poisson process, with constant average sampling interval.
22// This follows the exponential probability distribution with parameter
23// λ = 1/rate where rate is the average number of bytes between samples.
24//
25// Let u be a uniformly distributed random number between 0 and 1, then
26// next_sample = (- ln u) / λ
27intptr_t SamplingHeapProfiler::Observer::GetNextSampleInterval(uint64_t rate) {
28 if (v8_flags.sampling_heap_profiler_suppress_randomness)
29 return static_cast<intptr_t>(rate);
30 double u = random_->NextDouble();
31 double next = (-base::ieee754::log(u)) * rate;
32 return next < kTaggedSize
33 ? kTaggedSize
34 : (next > INT_MAX ? INT_MAX : static_cast<intptr_t>(next));
35}
36
37// Samples were collected according to a poisson process. Since we have not
38// recorded all allocations, we must approximate the shape of the underlying
39// space of allocations based on the samples we have collected. Given that
40// we sample at rate R, the probability that an allocation of size S will be
41// sampled is 1-exp(-S/R). This function uses the above probability to
42// approximate the true number of allocations with size *size* given that
43// *count* samples were observed.
44v8::AllocationProfile::Allocation SamplingHeapProfiler::ScaleSample(
45 size_t size, unsigned int count) const {
46 double scale = 1.0 / (1.0 - std::exp(-static_cast<double>(size) / rate_));
47 // Round count instead of truncating.
48 return {size, static_cast<unsigned int>(count * scale + 0.5)};
49}
50
51SamplingHeapProfiler::SamplingHeapProfiler(
52 Heap* heap, StringsStorage* names, uint64_t rate, int stack_depth,
53 v8::HeapProfiler::SamplingFlags flags)
54 : isolate_(Isolate::FromHeap(heap)),
55 heap_(heap),
56 allocation_observer_(heap_, static_cast<intptr_t>(rate), rate, this,
57 isolate_->random_number_generator()),
58 names_(names),
59 profile_root_(nullptr, "(root)", v8::UnboundScript::kNoScriptId, 0,
60 next_node_id()),
61 stack_depth_(stack_depth),
62 rate_(rate),
63 flags_(flags) {
64 CHECK_GT(rate_, 0u);
65 heap_->AddAllocationObserversToAllSpaces(&allocation_observer_,
66 &allocation_observer_);
67}
68
69SamplingHeapProfiler::~SamplingHeapProfiler() {
70 heap_->RemoveAllocationObserversFromAllSpaces(&allocation_observer_,
71 &allocation_observer_);
72}
73
74void SamplingHeapProfiler::SampleObject(Address soon_object, size_t size) {
75 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
76
77 // Check if the area is iterable by confirming that it starts with a map.
78 DCHECK(IsMap(HeapObject::FromAddress(soon_object)->map(isolate_), isolate_));
79
80 HandleScope scope(isolate_);
81 Tagged<HeapObject> heap_object = HeapObject::FromAddress(soon_object);
82 Handle<Object> obj(heap_object, isolate_);
83
84 // Since soon_object can be in code space or trusted space we can't use
85 // v8::Utils::ToLocal.
86 DCHECK(obj.is_null() ||
87 (IsSmi(*obj) ||
88 (V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE_BOOL && IsCodeSpaceObject(heap_object)) ||
89 IsTrustedSpaceObject(heap_object) || !IsTheHole(*obj)));
90 auto loc = Local<v8::Value>::FromSlot(obj.location());
91
92 AllocationNode* node = AddStack();
93 node->allocations_[size]++;
94 auto sample =
95 std::make_unique<Sample>(size, node, loc, this, next_sample_id());
96 sample->global.SetWeak(sample.get(), OnWeakCallback,
97 WeakCallbackType::kParameter);
98 samples_.emplace(sample.get(), std::move(sample));
99}
100
101void SamplingHeapProfiler::OnWeakCallback(
102 const WeakCallbackInfo<Sample>& data) {
103 Sample* sample = data.GetParameter();
104 Heap* heap = reinterpret_cast<Isolate*>(data.GetIsolate())->heap();
105 bool is_minor_gc = Heap::IsYoungGenerationCollector(
106 heap->current_or_last_garbage_collector());
107 bool should_keep_sample =
108 is_minor_gc
109 ? (sample->profiler->flags_ &
110 v8::HeapProfiler::kSamplingIncludeObjectsCollectedByMinorGC)
111 : (sample->profiler->flags_ &
112 v8::HeapProfiler::kSamplingIncludeObjectsCollectedByMajorGC);
113 if (should_keep_sample) {
114 sample->global.Reset();
115 return;
116 }
117 AllocationNode* node = sample->owner;
118 DCHECK_GT(node->allocations_[sample->size], 0);
119 node->allocations_[sample->size]--;
120 if (node->allocations_[sample->size] == 0) {
121 node->allocations_.erase(sample->size);
122 while (node->allocations_.empty() && node->children_.empty() &&
123 node->parent_ && !node->parent_->pinned_) {
124 AllocationNode* parent = node->parent_;
125 AllocationNode::FunctionId id = AllocationNode::function_id(
126 node->script_id_, node->script_position_, node->name_);
127 parent->children_.erase(id);
128 node = parent;
129 }
130 }
131 sample->profiler->samples_.erase(sample);
132 // sample is deleted because its unique ptr was erased from samples_.
133}
134
135SamplingHeapProfiler::AllocationNode* SamplingHeapProfiler::FindOrAddChildNode(
136 AllocationNode* parent, const char* name, int script_id,
137 int start_position) {
138 AllocationNode::FunctionId id =
139 AllocationNode::function_id(script_id, start_position, name);
140 AllocationNode* child = parent->FindChildNode(id);
141 if (child) {
142 DCHECK_EQ(strcmp(child->name_, name), 0);
143 return child;
144 }
145 auto new_child = std::make_unique<AllocationNode>(
146 parent, name, script_id, start_position, next_node_id());
147 return parent->AddChildNode(id, std::move(new_child));
148}
149
150SamplingHeapProfiler::AllocationNode* SamplingHeapProfiler::AddStack() {
151 AllocationNode* node = &profile_root_;
152
153 std::vector<Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo>> stack;
154 JavaScriptStackFrameIterator frame_it(isolate_);
155 int frames_captured = 0;
156 bool found_arguments_marker_frames = false;
157 while (!frame_it.done() && frames_captured < stack_depth_) {
158 JavaScriptFrame* frame = frame_it.frame();
159 // If we are materializing objects during deoptimization, inlined
160 // closures may not yet be materialized, and this includes the
161 // closure on the stack. Skip over any such frames (they'll be
162 // in the top frames of the stack). The allocations made in this
163 // sensitive moment belong to the formerly optimized frame anyway.
164 if (IsJSFunction(frame->unchecked_function())) {
165 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> shared = frame->function()->shared();
166 stack.push_back(shared);
167 frames_captured++;
168 } else {
169 found_arguments_marker_frames = true;
170 }
171 frame_it.Advance();
172 }
173
174 if (frames_captured == 0) {
175 const char* name = nullptr;
176 switch (isolate_->current_vm_state()) {
177 case GC:
178 name = "(GC)";
179 break;
180 case PARSER:
181 name = "(PARSER)";
182 break;
183 case COMPILER:
184 name = "(COMPILER)";
185 break;
186 case BYTECODE_COMPILER:
187 name = "(BYTECODE_COMPILER)";
188 break;
189 case OTHER:
190 name = "(V8 API)";
191 break;
192 case EXTERNAL:
193 name = "(EXTERNAL)";
194 break;
195 case LOGGING:
196 name = "(LOGGING)";
197 break;
198 case IDLE:
199 name = "(IDLE)";
200 break;
201 // Treat atomics wait as a normal JS event; we don't care about the
202 // difference for allocations.
203 case ATOMICS_WAIT:
204 case JS:
205 name = "(JS)";
206 break;
207 }
208 return FindOrAddChildNode(node, name, v8::UnboundScript::kNoScriptId, 0);
209 }
210
211 // We need to process the stack in reverse order as the top of the stack is
212 // the first element in the list.
213 for (auto it = stack.rbegin(); it != stack.rend(); ++it) {
214 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> shared = *it;
215 const char* name = this->names()->GetCopy(shared->DebugNameCStr().get());
216 int script_id = v8::UnboundScript::kNoScriptId;
217 if (IsScript(shared->script())) {
218 Tagged<Script> script = Script::cast(shared->script());
219 script_id = script->id();
220 }
221 node = FindOrAddChildNode(node, name, script_id, shared->StartPosition());
222 }
223
224 if (found_arguments_marker_frames) {
225 node =
226 FindOrAddChildNode(node, "(deopt)", v8::UnboundScript::kNoScriptId, 0);
227 }
228
229 return node;
230}
231
232v8::AllocationProfile::Node* SamplingHeapProfiler::TranslateAllocationNode(
233 AllocationProfile* profile, SamplingHeapProfiler::AllocationNode* node,
234 const std::map<int, Handle<Script>>& scripts) {
235 // By pinning the node we make sure its children won't get disposed if
236 // a GC kicks in during the tree retrieval.
237 node->pinned_ = true;
238 Local<v8::String> script_name =
239 ToApiHandle<v8::String>(isolate_->factory()->InternalizeUtf8String(""));
240 int line = v8::AllocationProfile::kNoLineNumberInfo;
241 int column = v8::AllocationProfile::kNoColumnNumberInfo;
242 std::vector<v8::AllocationProfile::Allocation> allocations;
243 allocations.reserve(node->allocations_.size());
244 if (node->script_id_ != v8::UnboundScript::kNoScriptId) {
245 auto script_iterator = scripts.find(node->script_id_);
246 if (script_iterator != scripts.end()) {
247 Handle<Script> script = script_iterator->second;
248 if (IsName(script->name())) {
249 Tagged<Name> name = Name::cast(script->name());
250 script_name = ToApiHandle<v8::String>(
251 isolate_->factory()->InternalizeUtf8String(names_->GetName(name)));
252 }
253 Script::PositionInfo pos_info;
254 Script::GetPositionInfo(script, node->script_position_, &pos_info);
255 line = pos_info.line + 1;
256 column = pos_info.column + 1;
257 }
258 }
259 for (auto alloc : node->allocations_) {
260 allocations.push_back(ScaleSample(alloc.first, alloc.second));
261 }
262
263 profile->nodes_.push_back(v8::AllocationProfile::Node{
264 ToApiHandle<v8::String>(
265 isolate_->factory()->InternalizeUtf8String(node->name_)),
266 script_name, node->script_id_, node->script_position_, line, column,
267 node->id_, std::vector<v8::AllocationProfile::Node*>(), allocations});
268 v8::AllocationProfile::Node* current = &profile->nodes_.back();
269 // The |children_| map may have nodes inserted into it during translation
270 // because the translation may allocate strings on the JS heap that have
271 // the potential to be sampled. That's ok since map iterators are not
272 // invalidated upon std::map insertion.
273 for (const auto& it : node->children_) {
274 current->children.push_back(
275 TranslateAllocationNode(profile, it.second.get(), scripts));
276 }
277 node->pinned_ = false;
278 return current;
279}
280
281v8::AllocationProfile* SamplingHeapProfiler::GetAllocationProfile() {
282 if (flags_ & v8::HeapProfiler::kSamplingForceGC) {
283 isolate_->heap()->CollectAllGarbage(
284 GCFlag::kNoFlags, GarbageCollectionReason::kSamplingProfiler);
285 }
286 // To resolve positions to line/column numbers, we will need to look up
287 // scripts. Build a map to allow fast mapping from script id to script.
288 std::map<int, Handle<Script>> scripts;
289 {
290 Script::Iterator iterator(isolate_);
291 for (Tagged<Script> script = iterator.Next(); !script.is_null();
292 script = iterator.Next()) {
293 scripts[script->id()] = handle(script, isolate_);
294 }
295 }
296 auto profile = new v8::internal::AllocationProfile();
297 TranslateAllocationNode(profile, &profile_root_, scripts);
298 profile->samples_ = BuildSamples();
299
300 return profile;
301}
302
303const std::vector<v8::AllocationProfile::Sample>
304SamplingHeapProfiler::BuildSamples() const {
305 std::vector<v8::AllocationProfile::Sample> samples;
306 samples.reserve(samples_.size());
307 for (const auto& it : samples_) {
308 const Sample* sample = it.second.get();
309 samples.emplace_back(v8::AllocationProfile::Sample{
310 sample->owner->id_, sample->size, ScaleSample(sample->size, 1).count,
311 sample->sample_id});
312 }
313 return samples;
314}
